channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'We will not leave': Palestinian President demands UN action to end Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appealed to the UN General Assembly for urgent intervention to end the conflict between Israel and Hamas in Gaza. He highlighted the severe destruction in Gaza, calling for a ceasefire, humanitarian access, and Israeli withdrawal. Abbas also stressed that the Palestinian Authority should manage Gaza's borders and promised elections after peace is achieved.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I'm stepping away because ... ': Why Mira Murati quit as CTO Of OpenAI
item.description: Mira Murati has decided to resign from her role as chief technology officer at OpenAI to focus on personal exploration. CEO Sam Altman expressed his gratitude for her contributions. Additionally, two other top executives, Bob McGrew and Barret Zoph, are also leaving the company independently and amicably, according to Altman.

item.title: Jhumpa Lahiri declines a Noguchi Museum Award over a ban on kaffiyehs
item.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Jhumpa Lahiri has turned down an award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens over its new ban on political attire for staff, leading to the dismissal of three employees who wore kaffiyehs. The museum defends this policy as necessary to avoid alienating visitors, despite significant staff opposition.

item.title: Yunus rules out running in poll, says Hasina must be extradited
Top Republican wants Ukrainian ambassador to US fired, ahead of Zelenskyy visit
item.description: Republican leaders have expressed anger over Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's visit to an ammunition plant in Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state. Former President Trump criticized Zelenskiy for not negotiating with Russia. The House Oversight Committee will investigate if the visit was aimed at aiding Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign efforts.

item.title: 'To keep government open': What is stopgap spending bill signed by Joe Biden
item.description: Joe Biden signed a stopgap spending bill to avert an immediate government shutdown, keeping the US government operational until mid-December. The bill maintains current funding levels for agencies and provides additional funds for the Secret Service. Biden highlighted support for national defense, veterans, and working families while opposing IRS budget cuts targeting wealthy tax evaders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California apologizes for slavery, its effects on Black Americans
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed a law formally apologizing for slavery and its effects on Black Americans. This is part of a series of reparations bills aimed at addressing racial disparities. Although no direct payment legislation was passed, Newsom approved a budget with up to $12 million for reparations legislation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 1 child killed, 25 cops injured in Pakistan police station blast
item.description: An explosion at a police station in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province has led to the death of one child and injuries to 25 people, primarily police officers. The blast is believed to have been caused by a short circuit. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with injured individuals transported to the district headquarters hospital for medical care.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Ukraine will win this war’: Biden to Zelenskyy while discussing victory plan in war with Russia
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris to discuss Ukraine's Victory Plan as the war with Russia continues. Zelenskyy expressed gratitude for US support, while Biden reiterated America's commitment. The meeting followed an announcement of a new $8 billion aid package for Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Parents accountable for ... ': What is new gun law signed by Joe Biden targeting active shooter drills in schools
item.description: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order aimed at reducing gun violence by targeting 3D-printed guns and machine guns. The order calls for universal background checks, safe firearm storage, and improved active shooter drills in schools. Vice President Kamala Harris stressed the need to reinstate the assault weapons ban during her first gun-related event with Biden.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sleepless in Kyiv: Ukraine faces constant drone attacks
item.description: Kyiv endured another night of air raid alerts and drone attacks, leading to explosions across various districts. Residents often take refuge in bomb shelters, with children and the elderly particularly affected. Ukrainian air defense forces work tirelessly to intercept drones as the city continues to hope for an end to these nightly disruptions.
item.dc:creator: U Sudhakar Reddy

item.title: Chinese doctor banned for three years after woman dies following herbal tea treatment
item.description: Dr Shuquan Liu, a Chinese medical practitioner in Australia, has been banned from practising for three years after prescribing herbal tea to a woman with heart issues, who later died. The tribunal found him guilty of professional misconduct for failing to gather sufficient information before administering the treatment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hezbollah’s aerial commander Muhammad Hussein Srour reportedly killed by IAF
item.description: The Israeli Air Force has reportedly eliminated Muhammad Hussein Srour, the commander of Hezbollah’s Aerial Command, in a precise strike in Beirut. Linked to numerous aerial terrorist operations and UAV production near civilian areas, his death marks a significant blow to Hezbollah's capabilities and their recent activities against Israeli civilians and soldiers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' climate advocacy questioned as presidential campaign racks up millions in private jet expenses
item.description: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign is under scrutiny for spending $3.8 million on private jets in six weeks, conflicting with her strong climate action stance. The use of energy-intensive private aviation raises questions about her commitment to reducing emissions, despite the Biden-Harris administration's ambitious climate goals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Grimaced': Prince Harry's snide remarks that broke Kate Middleton's heart
item.description: ​"Meg squeezed some onto her finger and applied it to her lips. Kate grimaced. Small clash of styles, maybe? Something we should've been able to laugh about soon after. But it left a little mark. And then the press sensed something was up and tried to turn it into something bigger. Here we go, I thought sorrowfully," Harry wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gunshots near Guinea’s presidential palace spark lockdown, force evacuations
item.description: Gunshots near Guinea’s presidential palace in Conakry led to a military lockdown. Since President Alpha Conde's ousting in 2021 by Colonel Mamadi Doumbouya, the country has faced criticism over transparency and progress. With elections set for 2025, ECOWAS is urging a return to civilian rule while Doumbouya resists foreign intervention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 600, displace 90,000 as Lebanese civilians flee in Desperation
item.description: Israeli air strikes have forced thousands of Lebanese civilians to flee their homes amid escalating cross-border attacks with Hezbollah. Over 600 lives have been lost in southern Lebanon, displacing 90,000 people. Civilians seek refuge in safer regions like the Bekaa Valley and Mount Lebanon, where local volunteers strive to provide essential aid despite limited resources.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Shootout in Mexico: 11 armed attackers killed in police confrontation
item.description: A violent confrontation in Nuevo Leon, Mexico resulted in the deaths of 11 armed attackers who targeted a police station in General Teran. State police, the national guard, and the army launched an operation that led to capturing one suspect and seizing six pick-up trucks while pursuing the attackers along a highway near Monterrey.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I don't think...': Elon Musk responds to exclusion from UK international investment summit
item.description: Elon Musk has been excluded from the UK's International Investment Summit due to his controversial social media posts criticizing UK policies on prison overcrowding. This decision follows last month's Southport riots, where some were jailed for inciting violence online. Officials view his absence as a significant loss for the event aimed at attracting foreign investment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 10-year-olds' reaction to Donald Trump, Kamala Harris viral: 'Liar, pure evil'
item.description: CNN interviewed 80 elementary school children from Arizona, New Jersey, and Texas to understand their views on presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris. Responses included calling Harris a 'liar' and Trump 'pure evil.' Despite differing opinions, most kids supported the idea of having a woman of color as president, CNN said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
